definition: to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: But few of the bowls had ever been found intact.
sentences.chinese: 但是完好无缺的很少发现。

sentences.english: She still has a perfect set of teeth at eighty.
sentences.chinese: 她八十岁了，一副牙齿仍然完好无缺。

sentences.english: The grief that would be averted. The lives and futures that would be intact.
sentences.chinese: 也许这种悲伤并不可怕，也许生命和未来都完好无缺。

sentences.english: The discovery of Tutankhamen's intact tomb.
sentences.chinese: 图他卡门的陵墓，完好无缺地出土。

definition: safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
original spot/previous place/where it was before
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
